subject: Remove incorrect mount entry
commitMessage:
Remove incorrect mount entry

/var isn't /opt/var anymore, filesystem package installed basic dir
structure in /var.

Change-Id: Ica473439fc97d767d07bf2f5c545861a626e479c
Signed-off-by: Chengwei Yang <chengwei.yang@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I guess the original intention was to make / read-only. that's why to bind mount /opt/var to /var, since /opt is a read-write partition.

So the question is: do we still want this feature?

Let's keep the possibility.

Patch Set 1:

otherwise, we need fix filesystem

Patch Set 1:

Or .ks file? before write any files into /var, make /var a link (or find mount) of /opt/var...

Patch Set 1:

Both /opt/var and /var are not empty and they're different. /opt/var seems not used as widely as /var. And /opt/var has no some basic directories, like log to make system run. I think we should clean /opt/var first and move /var to /opt and then create link, bind mount of /var to /opt/var.

Do you mind I merge this? This patch fix a lot of issues, like rpm doesn't work, Xorg can not write log, maybe more.

Anyway, it's quite far away from a readonly / fs.

Patch Set 1:

you don't fiddle with files in /var/ and /opt/var/ *after* everything is installed; instead, this needs to be done before packages installing, i.e.: in .ks file, we need to link or bind mount /var into /opt/var, that way, all packages transparently write files into /opt/var...

And then, during booting, we need to bind mound /var into /opt/var. everything is good now.

We will discuss this in today's meeting: whether we need to keep / ro...

Patch Set 1:

Yes, I understand, I mean /opt/var has its own files in it, before do link or bind mount, we need clean /opt/var, it's better if we know the background why creating some directories in /opt/var.

Since we didn't meet this kind of problem in tizen_2.2, so I think there is no bind mount. So not sure if any one is using /opt/var/XXX.

Patch Set 1:

See change for filesystem here https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/#/c/14577/

Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

merge this change tmporarily to not block boot up.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: systemd will take care of API fs mount
commitMessage:
systemd will take care of API fs mount

Since systemd will take care of these API fs mount, so remove them from
fstab, in addition, in systemd, there is a tmp.mount which has different
mount options, especially the smackfsroot=* option.

Change-Id: I5816967b17fd2a6ace21d2bdbf7108f204e4993c
Signed-off-by: Chengwei Yang <chengwei.yang@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
